fields.name: Demongate
fields.description: While visiting your friend Lorin, a cleric at the Abbey of Light, the Abbey is attacked by undead! Now you must find the source of the undead attack and avenge your friend!
fields.intro_text:
On your way home from a distant adventure, you decide to stop and visit your old friend Lorin, a cleric at the Abbey of Light. You arrive at the Abbey to find a busy scene, with people cleaning up debris and building new fortifications. There are many soldiers about, too, some of them wounded.

Lorin explains that a few weeks earlier, a visiting wizard left a golden ankh at the Abbey for safe-keeping. The wizard said that the ankh is the key to a gateway from our world to a demonic realm. Recently, the Dark Lord had used the gateway to summon a powerful demon, which wreaked havoc before the wizard could finally defeat it with the help of a band of adventurers.

Since the ankh's arrival, the Dark Lord has concentrated a large force of his minions against the Abbey. In the last three days, there have been several attacks which left many brothers dead or wounded.

Lorin takes you up on the walls to show you a terrifying sight: a great wall of darkness looming over the forest a mile north of the Abbey, shot through with swirls of eerie colors. "That is the Shadow Wall," he explains. "It appeared a few years ago, when the Dark Lord began his reign of terror, and it has become stronger since the arrival of the Ankh.

"There is another abbey beyond the wall, which has been abandoned for years. The armies of orcs and undead always come from that direction. We fear that the Dark Lord's army is rebuilding and is stationed there. There might be another attack is coming at any time!"

You decide to stay and help the soldiers prepare for the coming battle. Later that day, as you cross the courtyard to fill a bucket of water, you hear a warning. 'Behind you!' a woman's voice yells. You spin and confront an approaching zombie. You glance around but see no sign of the woman who warned you. The zombie presses closer toward you, a spear clutched in its rotting hand.

You dodge the spear's thrust, but the spear becomes tangled in your robe! Jerking yourself free, your feet slip over the edge of the well. You fall.

As you hit the stone wall of the well, there is a loud crash from above, and a brilliant flash of bright colors. Then, darkness and silence.

fields.name: In the well [u]
fields.description: As you wake up, you are aware of being cold and in pain. Your head hurts, your back aches, and everything screams pain. As you open your eyes, you find yourself looking at the rough sides of a stone well. In the explosion, some debris landed in the well along with you, giving you a way to climb up to the surface.

fields.name: Near the well [n,s,e,w,d]
fields.description: As you look around the area surrounding the well, you can see the devastation that remains in the abbey courtyard in all directions. The temple is further south and the gatehouse is north. Bodies are scattered everywhere.

fields.name: In the eastern courtyard. [w]
fields.description: The carnage is the same here. Bodies litter the yard. Some wearing rusted armor and in a state of decay. Some are the bodies of your friends. The wall to the east is still standing. A stable wall is north. South is the temple wall.

fields.name: At the door of the temple [n,s,e,w]
fields.description: You stand before the temple. The doors are open. All is silent. There is a courtyard east and a barracks is west.

fields.name: In the temple. [n]
fields.description: The temple is lit by a few torches and candles on the altar. Glittering on the altar is a mace and a chalice full of blue liquid. The ankh is missing.

fields.name: In a barracks.[e]
fields.description: The barracks is almost empty. Many of the slain are lying on the floor in pools of blood.

fields.name: Between the barracks. [e]
fields.description: You have entered an area between the two barracks. The slain bodies are even here.

fields.name: In a barracks [e]
fields.description: As you enter the barracks, your knees almost buckle. There in their beds, are many of the abbey's brothers, murdered in their sleep.

fields.name: At the gatehouse. [n,s,e,w]
fields.description: You are at the gatehouse of the abbey. The shadow wall lies to the north. The abbey is to the south. A stable is east. A barracks is west.

fields.name: In front of the abbey. [n,s]
fields.description: As you leave the abbey, you stand at the edge of a broad valley. To the north, you can see the looming shadow that has become known as the Shadow Wall. The road leads north toward it. To the south, the gates of the Abbey of Light stand wide open.

fields.name: In the forest
fields.description: There is dense forest here. The only route north is the one left by the Dark Lord's army. The Shadow Wall seems to be getting larger.

fields.name: At the shadow wall
fields.description: Looming in front of you to the north is the shadow wall. It flickers like a will-o-the-wisp. The colors seem to go from green to purple in a swirling pattern. The tracks of the Dark Lord's army lead north, right into the shadows. You can't see beyond the edge of the wall.

fields.name: In the shadow wall.
fields.description: You have entered the shadow wall, the mist and colors swirling around you. You can only see a few feet in any direction. After walking for some distance in the wall, you arrive at a huge outcropping of rock. You can no longer go north. The wall is thick and makes breathing hard. You wish the voice would help. You wait but all you hear is silence.

fields.name: In the wall.
fields.description: You wander through the shadow-wall, not sure of your direction. The texture of the swirling mists is unnerving. You cannot see more than a few feet in any direction.

fields.name: In the wall.
fields.description: The wall continues in all directions. At times it seems to try to slow your movement. You wonder why your voice is not here. You begin to wonder why you are here.

fields.name: In the shadow wall
fields.description: The bands of the wall seem to be getting closer together and push back to slow you down. You feel so alone. Which is the way?

fields.name: In the wall.
fields.description: You have found the rock outcropping to the east and north. This does not seem to be the correct way. You wish you had some help.

fields.name: Still in the wall.
fields.description: You round the rock and are able to move north again. The wall seems to be thinning. You can make out a mountain to the west.

fields.name: In a box canyon.  [s]
fields.description: As the wall fades you realize you are in a box canyon. High cliffs surround you to the west, north, and east. You can only return south, back into the shadow-wall.

fields.name: In the shadow wall [w,n]
fields.description: The rock is northwest of you. You can see that the trail of the army goes west and north. The colors of the wall swirl as you make your way through.

fields.name: In the wall.
fields.description: Looming above your head is an overhang of rock. It makes you uneasy. You can only see a few feet ahead. The steep rocks stop movement to the west.

fields.name: In the wall.[n,s]
fields.description: The wall seems to be thinning as you go north. Signs of travel are visible. The rocks stop movement west. A river is to the east.

fields.name: In the wall.
fields.description: Walking through the wall has left you feeling nervous. You wonder about your quest, the voice in your head, or why this has happened. The trail begins to grow dim. A river is east. A faint trail leads west.

fields.name: In a clearing  [n,e]
fields.description: As you rush into the clearing, you realize that the sun is shining through the haze. The wall is growing thinner. You have made it through!

fields.name: At a fork in the trail.[n,s,e,w]
fields.description: The trail divides here, with forks going north, east, and west. There doesn't seem to be any difference in the amount of travel.

fields.name: On a e-w trail
fields.description: You are traveling down an east-west trail. It has seen some travel but not too much.

fields.name: On a e-w trail [e,w]
fields.description: The east-west trail grows fainter. There is very little vegetation here, and most of it is withered as though something is sucking the life from it. There is some sort of structure to the east.

fields.name: Following a faint trail [n,s]
fields.description: You walk for some time, chatting as if on a simple hike in the forest. The quest pushed back in your mind. Almost afraid to think about your possible fate. You do notice the vegatation is dying. You are aware that Lila has taken your arm.

fields.name: Nearing the abbey  [n,s]
fields.description: Topping a knoll, you are able to see a building in the distance. It is an abbey that looks very similar to the one you left only a short time ago. A graveyard is just outside the entrance.

fields.name: At the graveyard. [n,s,e]
fields.description: The shrubs are now a sickly white, as if drained of life. Even the sunlight has lost its warmth. As you arrive at the graveyard of the abbey, you think of the kind priests which are buried there, not aware of the evil in this land.

fields.name: In the graveyard. [w]
fields.description: The graveyard is like so many others. Stones are arranged in rows. There has not been any upkeep in many years.

fields.name: At the abbey entrance. [n,s,e,w]
fields.description: You stand at the entrance of the abbey. To the north is a high stone wall. Leading north into the wall is a 20-foot tunnel, partly blocked by a rusted iron gate. The abbey is surrounded by a wall three times your height, which has decayed over time. A road leads south into the graveyard, and you may follow the abbey wall east or west.

fields.name: Outside the abbey wall. [w, u]
fields.description: As you survey the abbey, walls you notice several places where the mortar has fallen out. You may be able to climb up. To the west is a trail back to the main gate of the abbey.

fields.name: By the abbey wall. [e,u]
fields.description: Like the rest of the abbey, the walls here are covered with crumbling mortar. There are some large areas where you may be able to climb up over the wall. A trail leads east, back toward the main gate.

fields.name: Just inside the gatehouse. [n,s]
fields.description: As you move inside the dim, ten-foot-wide tunnel, you notice that the far gate has been burned through. It once served as the only entrance to the abbey.

fields.name: In the tunnel, [n,s]
fields.description: Now in the tunnel, you are unable to see very well. There seems to be two dark blots just ahead. Maybe a doorway.

fields.name: In the abbey courtyard. [n,s,e,w]
fields.description: After the defeat of the skeleton guards, you walk boldly out into the courtyard. Then your confidence wanes when you see movement near the barracks to the west. A stable is east. The temple is straight ahead to the north.

fields.name: In the barracks  [e]
fields.description: The windows of the barracks are broken and empty. Cautiously entering the first building, you feel you are being watched...once inside you find the building is empty. There are footprints going out a window. You notice an object.

fields.name: In the stable. [w]
fields.description: Walking into the stables you survey the debris-filled room. There is no sound and no movement.

fields.name: In the courtyard. [w]
fields.description: As you enter this area of the courtyard you see nothing of interest.

fields.name: In the courtyard. [n,s,e,w]
fields.description: The courtyard appears empty. It extends further to the east. A barracks is to the west. The temple is north.

fields.name: In a barracks. [e]
fields.description: This building is much the same as the last building.

fields.name: In a corridor. [n,s]
fields.description: You have entered a corridor about five feet wide. There is a door on both ends.

fields.name: In a stable. [w]
fields.description: Entering the stable, you see that they have even killed the animals. You'll have to walk.

fields.name: At the doors of the temple. [n,s]
fields.description: The temple looks like a fortress. The windows are few and set high in the wall. There is only one entrance.

fields.name: In the temple. [s,e,w]
fields.description: You are in the temple of the abbey. It is a huge room with large doors in the south wall, leading out into the courtyard. Smaller doors lead east and west. The ceiling is lined with copper plates, making the sunlight even redder.

fields.name: In a side room. [n,s,e,w]
fields.description: You are in a dimly lit side room with no windows. In the dim light you are able to make out doors leading north, south, east, and west. Patches of blood stain the floor, but the room seems empty.

fields.name: In a closet [s]
fields.description: You have entered an empty closet. Dust hangs on the walls and lies deep on the floor. No one has entered here in quite some time. A door leads south.

fields.name: In a library [n]
fields.description: As you enter this large room, you notice that the walls are lined with shelves. It must have been the abbey's library. It is now almost empty. Light filters in through a small window, casting strange shadows. The room makes you afraid.

fields.name: At the top of a spiral staircase [e,d]
fields.description: You now stand at the top of a circular stairway. It spirals down into the inky darkness. In the candlelight, you see a dust covered floor. Numerous footprints disturb the dust, many of them not human. There is a door in the east wall.

fields.name: At the bottom of the stairs [n,w,u]
fields.description: Standing at the bottom of the spiral staircase, you feel the coolness of the air around you. You make out doors in the north and west stone walls. Footprints lead under the western door.

fields.name: In a wine cellar  [e]
fields.description: Rows of wine racks line this small room. They are now empty, where once they would have been full of sweet wine. Your mouth begins to water at the memory.

fields.name: In an empty storage room. [s]
fields.description: This storage room is empty. A dank smell fills the air. The floor is littered with trash. There seems to be no other exit.

fields.name: In an old chapel [n,w]
fields.description: The room is rectangular. Light from the setting sun filters in through the high narrow windows. The floor is covered with broken furniture. A charred altar confirms your suspicion that once this was a chapel.

fields.name: In a room with tables. [n,s]
fields.description: Entering the room, there seems to be no immediate danger. The walls are lined with tables.

fields.name: In a small chapel [s]
fields.description: You enter cautiously into a small chapel. The light is dim. Nothing moves. You feel a sense of relief. The north wall is very solid-looking.

fields.name: In a tunnel
fields.description: The tunnel is empty, a pleasant surprise. Footprints on the dusty floor warn of danger, but nothing appears. The tunnel winds downward. Hopefully toward your goal.

fields.name: In a large room.  [e,u]
fields.description: The tunnel empties into a large room with stone walls. You notice that the wall to the west is a lighter color stone. In the east wall is a door that is surely original. The tunnel also leads up, back toward the chapel.

fields.name: In a rough tunnel [e,w]
fields.description: Beyond the door, you find yourself in a tunnel. The walls are rough and are supported by unfinished beams. A shadow seems to move. Dust showers down on you. Spiderwebs hang throughout. Many are as thick as your finger.

fields.name: At a door [e,w]
fields.description: You are at the east end of a dark tunnel deep under the abbey. The tunnel continues into darkness to the west. To the east is a door. Above the door, mystic runes are carved into the stone.

fields.name: Large chamber [w]
fields.description: You enter a large room. The walls are of stone. An eerie light fills the chamber.

fields.name: In a passage outside [n,s]
fields.description: You pass through the broken wall of runes and find yourself in a passage leading outside. The walls are stone but the ceiling is open to the sky. The passage leads north out into the forest and south into the tunnels below the abbey. From the north you can the light of the moon.

fields.name: In the forest north of the abbey [s,e]
fields.description: The stars overhead twinkle. The full moon casts a brilliant glow across the land. You have been successful! The Dark Lord has been given a major setback. The pain you suffered is almost like a dream. You are exhausted but happy. To the east is a road that leads back to the Main Hall.

fields.name: At a fallen bridge [w]
fields.description: Rounding a corner, you spot a decaying bridge ahead. The timbers are rotting and falling. As you inspect the ruins you hear the voice in your head, 'Turn around,' It says. 'This is not the way. You are wasting time.'

fields.name: On an east-west trail
fields.description: The east-weat trail winds through the twisted trees. There are no animals, not even insects. A feeling of dread fills you. Tangled undergrowth stops travel north and south.

fields.name: On the east-west path
fields.description: The path you are following widens as you enter a valley. Mountains block any movement north or south. The sky seems to clear slightly. You can continue to go east or west.

fields.name: In a valley at a north-east bend
fields.description: The valley you are traveling through has a north-east bend. A cliff hangs over your head to the west. The rock is wet and smooth. A small stream flows by with yellowish water. You feel alone. You almost wish the voice would speak.

fields.name: In a valley at a south-west bend
fields.description: The valley winds until you reach a bend going west and south. It is beginning to get warm.

fields.name: At a north-east bend
fields.description: The trail bends again. This time from west to north.

fields.name: beam
fields.description: Under your chest is a wooden beam You landed on it, which probably kept you from drowning. It is eight feet long and about six inches thick. Your arms and legs dangle in the cold water.

fields.name: spear
fields.description: Here is a spear about seven feet long. The tip is of bronze.

fields.name: Lorin's body
fields.description: Sprawled awkwardly nearby is the body of Lorin. His head is missing and the flies have already begun to gather over his body. He was a good friend. You feel you should at least bury him.

fields.name: altar
fields.description: The altar is marble, six feet long and about three feet high. Carvings on the sides show the relationship of God and man. There are several candles set atop the altar.

fields.name: healing potion
fields.description: You see a small chalice with an iridescent blue liquid inside. You recognize it as the abbot's own special brew of healing potion.

fields.name: mace
fields.description: You see the high priest's mace. It has a long handle and wicked barbs on the tip. It's a pity the priest wasn't wielding it when the zombies attacked.

fields.name: rusty sword
fields.description: On the ground lies a rusty sword.

fields.name: club
fields.description: You see a well-worn club fashioned from an old tree branch. Some of the bark is still on it.

fields.name: dagger
fields.description: Here is a dagger with a curved blade belonging to Lila.

fields.name: sword
fields.description: The priest's sword is before you. It is old and rusted.

fields.name: broken spear
fields.description: Lying on the ground is a spear, old and broken. You could still use it as a weapon, but it would not be very effective.

fields.name: human finger
fields.description: As you pick up the small object, you recognize it as a human finger. One end has been gnawed by some very sharp teeth

fields.name: stable door
fields.description: The door of the stable is broken and falling apart. It is blocked by several fallen boards. You will have to force your way through.

fields.name: temple door
fields.description: The entrance has double doors that stand twice your height and are over fifteen feet wide. A rusted keyhole is visible in the center. This seems to be the only way into the temple.

fields.name: bent wire
fields.description: You notice a piece of wire. It is bent to resemble a key.

fields.name: altar
fields.description: The altar dominates the room. It is of bronze. The candles have been knocked into a corner, but the altar is basically unharmed.

fields.name: scroll
fields.description: The mummy dropped a scroll in a silver case.

fields.name: coffin
fields.description: In the dim light, it isn't until you are within a few feet of the altar that you notice a stone casket partially recessed into the floor. This must have been the founder of the order.

fields.name: broken candles
fields.description: These are the candles from the altar. They are broken but still usable.

fields.name: blood-stained door
fields.description: Looking to the west, you see a door. It has handprints on it, as if someone dipped their hands in blood and then leaned against the door. When you touch it with your weapon, the blood smears.

fields.name: door
fields.description: To the north is a door. It stands open about an inch. The floor near the door shows a wedge in the thick dust. Someone has used the door recently. Could it be a trap?

fields.name: closed door
fields.description: As you enter the room, the door slams. Checking it, you find it is locked. You have been trapped. The room is also growing warm.

fields.name: bricked-up wall
fields.description: The eastern wall is a lighter shade of stone, making you think that this is not part of the original construction. It seems solid, though, and completely blocks your passage.

fields.name: bricked-up wall
fields.description: As you look around, you notice that the western wall is a lighter shade of stone, making you think that this is not part of the original construction. It seems sturdy and solid, and there is no way through.

fields.name: small altar
fields.description: In the center of the room is a small altar, only knee high and a foot square. Behind it is a frustratingly solid wall. It begins to glow, making the room hot. You think that you better get out of here fast!

fields.name: gold coins
fields.description: On one table is a pile of gold coins.

fields.name: silver coins
fields.description: On another table lies several silver coins.

fields.name: solid wall
fields.description: Searching the wall for a secret way out, you push a small stone which causes the wall to slide open, revealing a tunnel north.

fields.name: broken sword
fields.description: Lying amid the rubble is a sword. Its tip is broken off.

fields.name: book
fields.description: You have found a book listing all the members of the orders. It goes back several hundred years, from the abbey's founding to the takeover of the Darklord.

fields.name: torch
fields.description: You see a torch.

fields.name: wine
fields.description: Several bottles of good wine fall to the floor.

fields.name: spear
fields.description: You see a standard spear.

fields.name: sword
fields.description: You see a standard sword.

fields.name: short sword
fields.description: You see a standard short sword.

fields.name: Ankh
fields.description:
You see an ankh about a foot tall, made from some mysterious golden stone. It radiates magic. This must be the mystic ankh which was brought to the Abbey of Light!

The priest was trying to use it to open the Shadow Gate and allow the demons from the other side to enter. The ankh appears very solid and sturdy, maybe even indestructible. You need to make sure that no one uses it again. But, how?

fields.name: wall of runes
fields.description: An unnatural green light emanates from runes in the north wall. You cannot read the writing, but you recognize a sign of evil which could be used again. You are reminded of what the spirit in the graveyard spoke to you.

fields.name: shelves
fields.description: The shelves are empty except for one book.

fields.name: silver armour
fields.description: One body has a gleaming suit of armour. The decaying flesh seems to be melting away.

fields.name: altar candles
fields.description: You find the candles from the altar.

fields.name: vegetation
fields.description: The plants here have become more stunted, their forms twisted. Their color is a sickly white, as if drained of life. There is no nourishment for anything alive.

fields.name: temple
fields.description: Dominating the abbey is the temple, a large stone building with small high-set windows.

fields.name: barracks
fields.description: Barracks are west. They are long-low buildings with the windows missing. They remind you of the eye sockets of a skull.

fields.name: runes
fields.description: The runes are carved in the wood around the doorway.

fields.name: ring of fire
fields.description: You see a gold ring with a brilliant orange gem set into it. The gem glitters with patterns that look like there are flames trapped within. It is a powerful Ring of Fire, that allows the user to shoot fire from his fingertips.

fields.name: decayed body of the zombie
fields.description: You hear a moan as the zombie topples. You expect another attack, but it now lies unmoving.

fields.name: remains of the shadow
fields.description: Each hit of your weapon seemed to cause pieces of the shadow to disolve, leaving only several small pieces.

fields.name: dead spider
fields.description: The body of the spider rolls over on its back as its legs loose their strength. With the exception of the quivering of its legs,there is no motion.

fields.name: Lila's body
fields.description: The bloody body of Lila falls to the ground near you. Her long flowing hair is soaked in her own blood. If only you could have saved her.

fields.name: dead orc
fields.description: The body of the orc slumps as the life flows from its veins. A fitting end for a follower of the darklord.

fields.name: dead orc
fields.description: The body of the orc slumps as the life flows from its veins. A fitting end for a follower of the darklord.

fields.name: broken bones of the harpy
fields.description: As you smash the bones of the harpy, it falls to the ground unable to move.

fields.name: pile of bones
fields.description: Before you is a pile of bones, that only seconds before attacked you. When broken they crumble, lifeless.

fields.name: pile of bones
fields.description: Before you is a pile of bones, that only seconds before attacked you. When broken they crumble, lifeless.

fields.name: dead ghoul
fields.description: Delivered to death, would be a fitting epitaph of one who worshiped death so. These ghouls are part of all you have spent your life trying to overcome.

fields.name: dead ghoul child
fields.description: It is so unusual to see a child turn in to a ghoul, but all things are possible in this world. You have little remorse at destroying so foul a creature. Even a young one.

fields.name: destroyed mummy
fields.description: With your attack, the mummy looses its integrity and crumbles.

fields.name: dead orc
fields.description: Defeated, the body of the drunken orc lies bleeding on the floor.

fields.name: pile of bones
fields.description: Before you is a pile of bones, that only seconds before attacked you. When broken they crumble, lifeless.

fields.name: remains of the wraith
fields.description: As you attack the wraith, it seems to shrink. Finally there is almost nothing left.

fields.name: remains of the wraith
fields.description: As you attack the wraith, it seems to shrink. Finally there is almost nothing left.

fields.name: destroyed zombie
fields.description: As a result of your attack, the zombie lies destroyed at your feet. Finally, death has fully claimed its body as well as its soul.

fields.name: destroyed zombie
fields.description: As a result of your attack, the zombie lies destroyed at your feet. Finally, death has fully claimed its body as well as its soul.

fields.name: destroyed zombie
fields.description: As a result of your attack, the zombie lies destroyed at your feet. Finally, death has fully claimed its body as well as its soul.

fields.name: spot where spirit stood
fields.description: As you attack, the spirit vanishes.

fields.name: dead spider
fields.description: The body of the spider rolls over on its back as its legs lose their strength. With the exception of the quivering of its legs, there is no motion.

fields.name: remains of the priest
fields.description: You see the robe of the priest fall to the floor empty. He vanished.

fields.name: destroyed zombie
fields.description: As a result of your attack, the zombie lies destroyed at your feet. Finally, death has fully claimed its body as well as its soul.

fields.name: dead orc
fields.description: The orc dies with a whimper.

fields.name: destroyed wall of runes
fields.description: A pile of rubble lies here, the remains of the wall of runes. The eerie green light has gone out, but the runes that are still visible give you chills. You may climb over the wreckage into a passage to the north.

fields.name: cudgel
fields.description: You see a poor-quality cudgel made from a length of plain wood.

fields.name: old sword
fields.description: You see an old, beat-up sword.

fields.text:
A woman's voice says, 'Wake up! You must wake up!'

You look around and see no one.

As you kneel to bury your friend, a voice says, 'Let the dead bury the dead. You must save the living. If you do not recover the ankh, the Darklord will be able to extend his control over the world.' You look and see no one.
'You must hurry!' the voice says. 'The ankh is even now on its way to be used to open a gate between this world and another. To find it go north through the shadow wall.'

'Go north and hurry!' is all you hear in your mind. You question who or what is talking to you. 'A friend' is the reply. 'I cannot talk. You must be careful.' You do not know why you are trust this voice. You just do.
'The shadow-wall is harmless.' You can not recognize the feminine voice you have come to trust. You wonder if you have gone insane.
'This is not the way! You have lost very valuable time. Hurry! I have had much diffulicity in talking to you. The times are desperate. I will help as i am able.' The voice trails off.

From the west, you hear the sounds of a struggle before you can see anything. 'It's not your concern. You have other important business' the voice admonishes... Then you hear the sound of a female voice crying for help.
Unsure, you begin to climb the wall. As you near the top, the mortar begins to give way. You tumble down, unhurt but angry.
The scroll contains the instructions for what looks like a powerful earthquake spell. You can use the scroll to activate it.
'The ankh is below. Hurry!' pleads the voice in your head weakly. You wait for more, but all you can hear is your own heart. After waiting several minutes, you think that you must do something.
Inside your head, the voice weakly says, 'Hurry! It is almost too late!'
The runes read, "Ye who know the might of the Dark Lord, enter."
The voice says, 'You must enter, but be ready. You have arrived just in time.'
Suddenly and with force the voice shouts 'Turn around! You are going the wrong way. Must I direct you every minute? Think. Time is short.'
The room shakes for several seconds, but nothing much seems to happen.

The room shakes for several seconds. The wall collapses into rubble! Now, no one will be able to use the Ankh to summon evil creatures.

You have saved the realm from the Dark Lord, for now. But, you feel that the Ankh shouldn't be left here for another evil priest to find. You wonder if another wizard could find a way to neutralize its power.
The room shakes for several seconds. The bricked-up wall is solid and does not crumble. If there's anything on the other side, you'll need to find a different way to get there.

You show the Ankh to Hokas Tokas. He takes you to see the Wizards' Guild and they give you a reward of 1,000 gold pieces for recovering such a powerful artifact. They take the Ankh to their laboratory for further study.

Lila spends a few days resting in Eamon Towne. Over drinks one evening, she tells you she's planning to find some new adventures somewhere as far away from the shadow wall and the Dark Lord's forces as she can get. Two days later, you bid her farewell as she sails on a ship bound for distant islands. You never see her again.

fields.name: zombie
fields.description: A zombie, clad in rusting armor, stands in your way to the temple. It is a head taller than you. The odor of decay fills the air. A spear is clutched in a hand that is as much bone as flesh. It moves with surprising speed.

fields.name: shadow
fields.description: Hovering near the doorway to the temple is a shadow. It moves silently.

fields.name: spider
fields.description: Dropping down the walls of the canyon are two giant spiders. Food is scarce here and you would make a good meal.

fields.name: Lila
fields.description: You see a dark-haired woman, almost your height, with a plain gown. She has a dagger with which she is holding at bay two orcs. She is less than 20 feet away when you enter the clearing. She runs toward you, pleading for your help.

fields.name: orc
fields.description: Rounding a bend, you are confronted by two orcs. Both you and they are stunned by the meeting. Before you can react, one strikes at you with his club, but you are able to deflect the full force of the blow.

fields.name: orc
fields.description: Rushing toward the woman are two orcs, barely humanoid. They have thick boney ridges over their eyes. Over their gray skin they wear tattered leather armour, and each carries a sword.

fields.name: harpy
fields.description: So intrigued with Lila, you fail to see the skeletal remains of the two harpies diving toward you. They strike without warning, knocking you down. You are not hurt, but overhead, the skeketal remains prepare to dive at you again.

fields.name: skeleton
fields.description: Suddenly, you see the glint of light on moving metal. You leap aside just as a skeletal hand jabs ineffectually in your direction. Two other skeletons emerge to block your path. From their robes, you see that they were once priests.

fields.name: skeleton
fields.description: A pile of bones in one corner rises as you enter. Its bony fingers reach for your throat.

fields.name: ghoul
fields.description: With a hiss of rage, a man-sized monster bolts through the door of the barracks. Its skin is a dark gray, almost white. It has sharp pointed teeth and red eyes. It is followed by two other ghouls.

fields.name: child ghoul
fields.description: The last ghoul waits on the far side of the room. It is smaller, like a child. You are hesitant to attack a child, even a ghoul. As you pause, the monster swings. You have no choice.

fields.name: mummy
fields.description: Inside the casket is a body wrapped in strips of cloth. Its arms are folded across its broad chest, guarding a silver case. As you reach for the scroll, the mummy's shrouded hands reach for your arm!

fields.name: drunk orc
fields.description: Sitting in one corner is an orc. You draw your weapon as he rises. Suddenly he sways and falls sending up a cloud of dust. He is drunk.

fields.name: skeleton
fields.description: As you look around the room, you notice a pile of bones on one side of the room... Before your eyes, they begin to move. They form figures which move toward you.

fields.name: wraith
fields.description: Bursting through the door to the north is a translucent shape, the size of a man but horribly destorted. The creature has no mouth, just a fanged gash. Its eyes glow a mad yellow. Claw-tipped fingers grab for your throat.

fields.name: wraith
fields.description: A dark shape glides toward you from the graveyard. It is dark with yellow eyes. It screams as though in torture.

fields.name: zombie
fields.description: Moving toward you are two zombies. Rotted flesh clings to the bones in places. Mindlessly they move, spears pointed at you.

fields.name: zombie
fields.description: Blocking your way, a zombie moves in front of you. Its flesh falls away as it moves. You are sickened by the smell. Shuffling toward you, it raises its sword.

fields.name: zombie
fields.description: To your left something moves...a zombie steps forward, sword in hand.

fields.name: tombstone
fields.description: Hovering over a tombstone is a spirit. It is a different color than the other. Painfully, it speaks, 'Be strong. You must destroy the wall of runes.' Then, it vanishes.

fields.name: spider
fields.description: Moving from the shadows, a form advances. It is a giant spider. Behind it is another, almost as large.

fields.name: dark priest
fields.description: A priest is kneeling as you enter. He stands and you are surprised to see that he is no older than you. His green robe flows as he whirls, firing. A bolt of fire leaps from his fingers. You leap aside.

fields.name: zombie
fields.description: From behind the altar, a zombie attacks.

fields.name: wounded orc
fields.description: Backing away from your approach is a wounded orc. He seems to be more scared of Lila than of you.

fields.question: Where can I find a light source?
Help! I'm lost in the shadow wall!
How do I get through the bricked-up wall?
What do I do with the Ankh?

fields.answer: Some light sources are listed in the room descriptions, but you have to LOOK or EXAMINE them to find them.
Try the temples. They have candles and torches. (LOOK CANDLE or LOOK TORCH)
The shadow wall is hard to navigate. Try dropping a useless artifact on the ground. That will help you see that you have wandered back to a place where you have already been.
The best path through the shadow wall is to go east one step, then keep going north.
You don't. But if you explore enough, you might find a different way to get to the other side.
The Ankh is the key to the Wall of Runes. You can't destroy the Ankh, but maybe you could do something else.
USE SCROLL to summon an earthquake which will destroy the wall. Then take the Ankh with you when you leave.
